items.title: Why Albanese's new hate speech laws were always going to face an uphill battle
items.summary: Labor has dropped racial vilification offences from its hate speech proposals. It's not the first time such a bid has failed.

items.title: Australia considers invitation to join Trump's 'Board of Peace' as world leaders react cautiously
items.summary: Initially established to oversee the future governance and reconstruction of Gaza, a draft charter suggests it would then expand.

items.title: 'Nothing but brave': Teenagers' actions praised after shark attack at Sydney Harbour beach
items.summary: The incident happened near Nielsen Park and Shark Beach, a popular swimming spot that has a netted area in Sydney Harbour.

items.title: 'Horrific' scenes as two high-speed trains derail in Spain, killing at least 21 people
items.summary: The crash occurred when a high-speed train travelling to Madrid derailed in Córdoba.

items.title: Starmer tells Trump it's 'wrong' to impose tariffs on European allies over Greenland
items.summary: Donald Trump and his administration have argued that Greenland coming under US rule would serve American "national security".

items.title: 'Worrying moment': Can Trump use tariffs to force a Greenland deal under international law?
items.summary: In his bid to control the autonomous Danish territory, Trump has vowed to hit European allies with additional levies.

items.title: I was a single parent just trying to survive. Then a new hobby changed everything
items.summary: Rather than being at home, Bridget Hallam always wanted to be "out in the world, living life". Then she found a way to do that.

items.title: Protesters vow to return on 26 January after deaths in custody demonstration dispersed
items.summary: In the lead-up to the event, demonstrators said they were planning to march in defiance of NSW's controversial new protest laws.

items.title: Thinking of changing your career this year? Consider these five steps before you do
items.summary: Between a shrinking job market, redundancies, and the threat of AI, changing careers in 2026 is different from how it used to be.

items.title: South Australian premier's push for Adelaide Festival to drop Abdel-Fattah revealed in letter
items.summary: A newly published letter shows how the South Australian premier argued for Randa Abdel-Fattah to be dropped from Adelaide Writers' Week.

items.title: Darren lengthened his legs to be taller. Now he walks with a limp
items.summary: More people than ever before are making themselves taller with surgery. But while this can improve lives, some are left with long-term problems.

items.title: A Mormon man donated DNA to his church. 15 years later, his son was accused of murder
items.summary: More than 30 million people globally have done a family history DNA test, but few realise this multi-billion dollar industry's origins trace back to the Mormon church.

items.title: Motive for Canberra pipe bombs still unknown, police say, after arresting 41-year-old
items.summary: Police believe the man acted alone and, while they haven't identified any motivation, "are confident it's not related to terrorism".

items.title: Woman killed by falling tree branch in NSW as storms force evacuations in Sydney
items.summary: Thunderstorms and heavy rain have swept across the state,

items.title: Iran's leader says 'several thousand' killed during anti-regime protests
items.summary: Human rights groups say more than 3,000 people have been killed and more than 20,000 arrested during the demonstratoins.

items.title: How much for a coffee? New drinks are pushing prices to $8 or more
items.summary: Classic coffee styles continue to dominate sales, but a new trend reflects a wider shift in tastes shaped by Australia's increasingly diverse population.

items.title: Government to separate gun laws, drop racial vilification from sweeping reform bill
items.summary: It comes after the Greens announced it would back the gun law reforms but refused to support the bill's other proposals.

items.title: How did Australia's 'most liveable' capital city become the most affordable for renting a house?
items.summary: Only one capital city in Australia has seen the cost of renting a house go down over the last 12 months.

items.title: She's a 'crazy pigeon lady'. He wants to revive a dying sport. This bird is their obsession
items.summary: Your perception of pigeons is wrong, these Australians say. Their lives revolve around them — but their worlds couldn't be more different.

items.title: US justice department investigating Minnesota governor for alleged ICE obstruction
items.summary: Minnesota governor Tim Walz said the justice ‌system was being weaponised to intimidate Donald Trump's perceived political enemies.

items.title: With the rise of AI in the workplace, is it time to shift to a four-day week?
items.summary: Australian workers are feeling exhausted and burnt out and experts believe it may be time to reassess working conditions.

items.title: 'Someone out there cares': When fires raged, a Melbourne baker opened his doors
items.summary: As fires displace thousands in Victoria, a Melbourne baker draws on his refugee past to help evacuees and emergency service volunteers.

items.title: Coroner refers exploited migrant worker's death to federal police
items.summary: The death of a migrant worker who was exploited and fearful of his visa sponsor has prompted calls for the creation of an anti-slavery hotline.

items.title: 'Risk of unintended consequences': Faith leaders call for pause in hate speech laws
items.summary: Religious leaders have united across faiths to urge the prime minister to go back to the drawing board on contentious hate speech reforms.
